column4: hey .. i got a sound issue ... i got sound during boot but not on login and in my desktop enviro ... any hints out there
did you check your mixer's volume settings?
i cant get to those settings ... No volume control GStreamer plugins and/or devices found. ... and other times it says to check if drivers are installed
then there might be a problem with the modules for your sound card. 'lsmod' will show you which modules are loaded
snd_page_alloc         11400  2 snd_intel8x0,snd_pcm
you should have more entries than that
I have ten lines returned by lsmod with 'snd' in them
thats the driver for it ... ill see how many snd lines i get
i got 10 lines also
though i see lots of oss stuff
have a look through /var/log/dmesg to see if there are any error messages relating to the sound card. Maybe /var/log/messages as well
i get the boot up sound ...
what do you mean by "the boot up sound"? The sound that's played when your desktop has loaded?
the music before the login screen ... but after hitting enter for my password the sound dont play
I don't get music before my login screen, but then I use kdm. It looks like your sound card  should work. What is it that makes you think it isn't workign?
no sound will play .. and i get errors on the sound apps ... but the sound plays before i arrive at the login screen so at the base level sound is working ... but in my user area its not
do you have another user you could log in to, and see if you can get sound as that user?
got sound at the switch user screen .. but no sound in the test acct
Very strange! Never heard of that before. Maybe it's a sound driver problem. I guess you're using esound under Gnome?
but you do know if you're using Gnome,right?
then I think you're using esound. And I'm out of ideas. And it's 2:30am here...
I hope someone else can help...
